properties.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued February 29 at 7:45PM PST until March 2 at 9:00PM PST by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
properties.description:
* WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves are expected
due to elevated surf of 3 to 6 feet. Highest on west- facing
beaches on Monday.

* WHERE...Santa Barbara County South Coast.

* WHEN...From Sunday morning through Monday evening.

* IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip
currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can
wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats
nearshore.
properties.instruction:
Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or
stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly
in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

NWSheadline: BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM PST SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY EVENING
